p: Other multitarget structures are the benzotriazole–coumarin ( Figure 7, general structure XXXII) and carbazole–coumarin ( Figure 7, general structure XXXIII) hybrids [ 48, 49]. In both cases, the molecules show antioxidant activity, as well as AChE and β-amyloid aggregation inhibitory properties. Finally, it is worth mentioning another type of hybrid, this time a furocoumarin that incorporates two fragments of resveratrol ( Figure 7, general structure XXXIV) [ 50]. Compounds containing this scaffold present AChE and BACE1 inhibitory properties related to the furocoumarin fragment, and antioxidant (radical scavenging) and COX-2 inhibition, related to the resveratrol [ 50].
